resources.string: Here you will find beautiful churches, cathedrals, plazas and museums to visit; so be sure to enjoy the magic of the city, lost in their small and quiet streets
pool, restaurant, meeting rooms, business center, fitness center, parking
36 comfortable standard rooms and 4 superior standard rooms, Restaurant, Meeting Room, Terrace off, Wetland
Restaurant, tour farms, internet, massage, bar

Millenio Dance Club is the most popular club among young people of Popayan and an excellent place to visit if you are after a long party, with music blaring crossover while enjoying a cold beer or a cocktail

To test the traditional Andean night party, your best option is to visit one of the famous Peña: great local live bands playing traditional music, happy people on the dance floor and spirits from the region overnight.
Enjoy karaoke contests, drinks and share with friends
Popayán,the capital, has a population of 300,000 inhabitants .

It is located in the center of the city and the Bolivar neighborhood, there a fault that makes it difficult to climb because of the name puente.El Puente del humilladero was once the main entrance to Popayan occurs. You may have missed this feature, but remains one of the most important historical monuments of the city and located on the road to El Morro de Tulcán. It was built in 1873 to cross the Mill River and, at present, it is used as a footbridge to avoid congested second streat.

This house was built in the eighteenth century by Don Jose Maria Mosquera and Figueroa, who left as a legacy to Tomás Cipriano de Mosquera. Over time, house was divided into three parts: Museum,the Historical Archives and the Smith Hotel

This monument was Built between 1673 and 1682, it is composed of a total of 96,000 bricks and has a clock of English origin, who was put in 1737.La Torre del reloj is located on the corner of 5th Street Race 7.

In 1929 it was discovered this wonderful place, which was described as pyramid, but it was actually a mountain that the Indians took to perform their rites. In the place human bones, pottery and other elements of pre-Columbian character were found. There is the statue of Sebastian de Belalcazar
